intro: Gratiola adenocaula, commonly known as the woolly yellowcrown, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
